translation:
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

On the 17th of this month, at 4 o'clock in the afternoon, I departed this city with 90 cavalrymen and 60-something infantrymen, German volunteers, embarked on two barges and two launches; and confronting the islands there, according to orders, the 3rd barge with 40-something horses and 3 war launches commanded by Navy Lieutenant Rocha joined me; and proceeding all under my command, I made a landing on the 18th at 4 o’clock in the early morning, at Santa Cruz; and from there I marched, with 40 cavalrymen on horseback and the aforementioned infantry commanded by Captain Christe, about one league along the coast of the arroyo dos Ratos, where I ordered a false cut to be made, and there I passed the men with considerable difficulty, in two canoes that I ordered to be brought trailing a horse girth for this purpose.

After completing the crossing, I divided the men and ordered several points to be surrounded, with the rebel guard at the mouth of the arroyo dos Ratos, at Leão's small farm and his meat-curing establishment; and with success in all places, seven rebels were killed, among whom were Legion Colonel José Manuel de Leão and the assassin Antônio Turpim, and nine were taken prisoner, including Lieutenant Jerônimo and Ensign Inocêncio; one hundred and some horses and one hundred and some cattle, including many tame oxen, some weapons and one hundred and some cartridges packed, one arroba of lead number B and seven bundles of white-handled knives, each bundle of 25 knives; the cartridges, lead, knives and 43 hides with hair, I delivered to the said Lieutenant Rocha.

With Your Excellency Leão’s arrival with the 8th Battalion, I proceeded under Your Excellency's orders to Ponta Rasa, and the other horses to the island of the Detachment, and a cattle barge and tame oxen to this capital. All the officers, non-commissioned officers and soldiers who accompanied me conducted themselves with great activity, subordination and valor, distinguishing themselves primarily Lieutenant Isaías, Ensign Carvalho and Corporal Fidélis Pais da Silva.

It is also very praiseworthy the activity of Navy Lieutenant Rocha, and through him all the rest of the navy that accompanied me. I shall not be more extensive because Your Excellency—Your Excellency Porto Alegre, September 21, 1839.

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Filipe Neri de Oliveira, Brigadier and Commander of the Brigade. Francisco Pedro de Abreu.

Death of Colonel José Manuel de Leão.
